p: Observational HIV research relies on robust data sources that accurately reflect the delivery of routine patient care, which is the underlying data‐generating mechanism. Due to the COVID‐19 pandemic, patient health behaviours and HIV clinical care models have changed. Patients may be unable to attend clinic due to COVID‐19 health concerns, reduced transportation and stay‐at‐home orders. Clinics globally have responded with increased remote interactions through telehealth, electronic patient portals, social media platforms and text and email messaging, as well as decentralized antiretroviral therapy (ART) delivery.
